articles.author: By QASSIM ABDUL-ZAHRA and BASSEM MROUE Associated Press
articles.title: Iraqi militant killed by US worked with Iran for decades
articles.description: BAGHDAD (AP) — Abu Mahdi al-Muhandis, a veteran Iraqi militant who was closely allied with Iran and rose to be a senior militia commander during the war against the Islamic State group, was killed overnight Friday in a U.S. strike…
articles.content: BAGHDAD (AP) Abu Mahdi al-Muhandis, a veteran Iraqi militant who was closely allied with Iran and rose to be a senior militia commander during the war against the Islamic State group, was killed overnight Friday in a U.S. strike that also felled Iran's top ge… [+5306 chars]

articles.title: Firefighters assess fire damage at abandoned Ohio factory
articles.description: MIDDLETOWN, Ohio (AP) — Firefighters continued to assess the damage after a large blaze this week at a long-abandoned Ohio factory that sent smoke into the air visible for miles.
articles.content:
MIDDLETOWN, Ohio (AP) Firefighters continued to assess the damage after a large blaze this week at a long-abandoned Ohio factory that sent smoke into the air visible for miles.
Water was poured on the former paper plant in Middletown in southwestern Ohio on … [+751 chars]

articles.author: By RICK EYMER Associated Press
articles.title: Davis nets 20 in Stanford’s 68-52 victory over Cal
articles.description: STANFORD, Calif. (AP) — Daejon Davis scored a season-high 20 points withsix rebounds and five assists in helping Stanford beat California 68-52 in the Pac-12 Conference opener for both teams Thursday night.
articles.content:
STANFORD, Calif. (AP) Daejon Davis scored a season-high 20 points withsix rebounds and five assists in helping Stanford beat California 68-52 in the Pac-12 Conference opener for both teams Thursday night.

articles.title: Canucks erase deficit, rally past Blackhawks 7-5
articles.description: VANCOUVER, British Columbia (AP) — Adam Gaudette scored a third-period goal and the Vancouver Canucks rallied from a two-goal deficit, extending their winning streak to six games with a 7-5 win over the Chicago Blackhawks on Thursday night.

articles.title: Clippers beat Pistons 126-112; George leaves with hamstring
articles.description: LOS ANGELES (AP) — Montrezl Harrell scored 23 points and the Los Angeles Clippers survived without Paul George in the second half to beat the Detroit Pistons 126-112 on Thursday night, winning consecutive games for the first time since Dec.…
